Hi,
I'm currently using Filters to keep in one place some redundant checks used by my controllers. Since I'm developing a multilingual website, I'm also using resources files to retrieve things like error messages. I've noticed that if a filter is set to "BeforeAction" execution, the controller.Resources property available in the Perform method is set to null, while if I set this same filter to "AfterAction", it is correctly initialized. Is it a design decision ? It seems rather strange to be unable to use the Resources property in a BeforeAction filter.
